results.title: Discovering harmony in art
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Productions
results.brief_description: Harmony is a pleasing agreement in the things we hear, see, or do. Many things are harmonious in the world of nature. Harmony in art can be achieved in various ways. Firstly by limiting the number of objects, colors and shapes we use; secondly, by repeating objects, colors and shapes; thirdly, by using related objects, colors and shapes.

results.title: Discovering electronic music (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Bernard Wilets
results.brief_description: Shows something of the physical basis of music and how it can be created and altered by electronic means. Demonstrates the sound synthesizer and its capacity to create, envelop and filter sound. Shows computer controlled music and a composition being created through the use of a computer.

results.title: Discovering democracy: stories of democracy (PC & MAC)
results.brief_description: A comprehensive tour using print, audio, video and graphic sources through the history and basic features of democracy as a system in Australia and internationally. This CD-rom provides specifically designed pathways of directed information and interactive learning about people, events and policies in relation to the history and current manifestations of democracy. Suitable for middle and upper primary students, as well as lower and middle secondary levels. It also contains constant explanation of terms used and citations of the sources drawn from - for independent research.

results.title: Discovering creative pattern
results.brief_description: A visually interesting film that presents a range of both natural and man made patterns. Provides practical ideas for creating patterns.This video has some useful classroom teaching applications.

results.title: Discovering color. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasing System, Paul Burnford and Jack Stoops
results.brief_description: Discusses differences in color in terms of hue, value, and intensity. Demonstrates techniques of color-mixing and explores the variety of color seen daily in the world around us. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Discovering color
results.brief_description: Three ways in which colors differ: hue, value and intensity. Hues as parts of the spectrum: red, orange, yellow, green, blue and violet. Between the basic hues are many in-between hues. The value of any hue may be lightened or darkened by adding white or black. The intensity of any hue can be lowered, or dulled, by adding its complementary hue. Techniques of color mixing: the great variety of color in the world around us.

results.title: Discovering aromatherapy
results.brief_description: An inspiring and easy to follow program which outlines the history of essential oils. Explores what aromatherapy is and examines the various ways it can be utilised to enhance quality of life. Includes information on sinusitus, hayfever, tension and stress, headaches, insomnia, PMT-pre-menstrual tension, burns, cuts, grazes, insect bites, travel sickness, arthritis and rheumatism, strains, sprains, childhood ailments, pets and beauty treatments. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE CONTENTS OF THIS VIDEO ARE FOR INFORMATION PURPOSES ONLY AND READ THE DISCLAIMER AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PROGRAM.

results.title: Discovering American folk music
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Bernard Wilets
results.brief_description: Reviews two main influences on the development of American folk music. Traces the history of one ballad from its original British version to its emergence in the West as the cowboy song, “Streets of Laredo”, and later in an African American blues version, “The St James Infirmary”.

results.title: Discover Sweden
results.creator_credit: J, D Tranword Communications, Journal Films and Dag Bengtsson
results.brief_description: Provides a general introduction to the social geography of Sweden. Presents visual and factual information on landscape, industries, transport and settlement, banking systems, politics, and education. Focuses on the country’s people describing the sports they enjoy, their religion and social customs. Useful for regional studies of Europe. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
